N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 504.5 - Placement process

State Regulations
(a) An individual
receiving transitional care funding shall be interviewed and his/her clinical
records evaluated for purposes of making a determination regarding an
appropriate placement and services for care and treatment. (b) An appropriate placement and services
will be sought which meet the individual's needs for care and treatment, as
determined by appropriate clinicians exercising professional judgement. The

Office of Mental Health shall also honor all requests for information regarding
non-residential services, including but not limited to at-home family
support. (c) The individual, the
individual's guardian, or another individual who has been actively involved in
the care of the individual and who can represent the individual's interests, shall be notified in writing of a proposed placement(s) and services. (d) A visit to the proposed placement(s)
shall be arranged for the individual, the individual's guardian, or another
individual who has been actively involved in the care of the individual and who
can represent the individual's interests. Such preliminary visits are necessary
for residential placement. Every effort shall be made to identify a convenient
time for all concerned. (e) A
refusal to visit the proposed placement(s) and/or services shall constitute
refusal of placement, at which time the commissioner or his/her designee shall
notify the appropriate local department of social services which shall
discontinue funding for transitional care for the individual. (f) Following a visit to the proposed
placement, the individual, the individual's guardian, or another individual who
has been actively involved in the care of the individual and who can represent
the individual's interests shall be notified in writing of the placement
determined to be appropriate and the approximate date of transfer. Such
notification shall include the program description and services to be provided
and shall identify a person(s) to whom questions regarding the placement may be
directed, an explanation of the administrative review process, and information
regarding the availability of the Mental Hygiene Legal Service. (g) An individual receiving transitional care
funding, the individual's guardian or another individual actively involved in
the care of the individual and who can represent the individual's interests may
choose to remain in the current placement, or otherwise chose not to accept a
placement identified as appropriate by the Office of Mental Health. The Office
of Mental Health shall notify the local department of social services which
shall discontinue funding for transitional care for the individual. Notes
